title: [K-12] Constructivist-Based Child and Adolescent Care Education Training Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Educational Theory and Understanding of Caregiving Experience
context.additional_context: A language education-linked program in a smartphone-centric, limited-technology environment. Designed for pre-service teachers to develop practical competencies applicable to real care settings by applying constructivist learning principles.

learning_goals: Learners can develop three or more reflective practice strategies using a care education design framework based on constructivist principles.
Participants can review their existing belief systems and improve at least two practical approaches through peer feedback and case analysis.
Learners can complete and present problem-solving projects for care scenarios using LMS-based collaboration tools.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
